entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main protagonist of the story. He is mentioned as having a steely glint in his eye and being incredulous about Hermione's plan.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Harry's friend who looks at him incredulously when Hermione suggests pulling out Crabbe and Goyle's hair.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: A student who comes up with a plan to investigate Malfoy by using the hair of Crabbe and Goyle. She is described as having a steely glint in her eye.

entities.name: crabbe
entities.description: A Slytherin student whose hair is needed for the potion. Hermione says that the potion will be useless without it.

entities.name: goyle
entities.description: A Slytherin student whose hair is needed for the potion.

entities.name: malfoy
entities.description: A Slytherin student who Hermione wants to investigate. Harry agrees to help her with this task.

entities.name: millicent bulstrode
entities.description: A student from the Duelling Club who left a hair on Hermione's robes when she was trying to strangle her.

entities.name: professor mcgonagall
entities.description: A teacher who is mentioned as having a similar steely glint in her eye to Hermione's.

relationships.description: Harry and Hermione are working together on a plan to investigate Malfoy.
Ron is Harry's friend who looks at him incredulously when Hermione suggests pulling out Crabbe and Goyle's hair.
Hermione needs Crabbe's hair for the potion.
Hermione also needs Goyle's hair for the potion.
Harry agrees to help Hermione investigate Malfoy.
Hermione and Millicent Bulstrode had a past conflict at the Duelling Club.
